explains: n. 顽童，淘气鬼；海胆；刺猬

sentences.en: They say he is a mischief-maker, a tramp, a street urchin—Calumnies!
sentences.cn: 他们说他是个捣蛋鬼，是个流浪汉，是个街头顽童——诋毁！

sentences.en: The spines of a fire urchin form a multicolored flower off Komodo Island, Indonesia.
sentences.cn: 火海胆的刺在印度尼西亚科莫多岛附近形成了五颜六色的花朵。

sentences.en: In the first century A.D., Pliny the Elder wrote of using sea urchin ashes to treat baldness.
sentences.cn: 公元一世纪，老普林尼曾写过用海胆的灰烬治疗来秃头。
